shortdesc.p: IBM StoredIQ Deployment and Configuration Guide provides information about how to plan, deploy, and configure the IBM StoredIQ product.

topicmeta.shortdesc: IBM StoredIQ Deployment and Configuration Guide provides information about how to plan, deploy, and configure the IBM StoredIQ product.

shortdesc.p: The IBM StoredIQ product library is updated annually. The current documents are relevant to this edition, Version 7.6.0.19 of product number 5724M86, and applies to all subsequent releases and modifications until otherwise indicated in new editions.

topicmeta.shortdesc: The IBM StoredIQ product library is updated annually. The current documents are relevant to this edition, Version 7.6.0.19 of product number 5724M86, and applies to all subsequent releases and modifications until otherwise indicated in new editions.

shortdesc.p: For IBM StoredIQ technical support or to learn about available service options, contact IBM StoredIQ customer support at 1-866-227-2068 or http://www.ibm.com/contact/us/.

topicmeta.shortdesc: For IBM StoredIQ technical support or to learn about available service options, contact IBM StoredIQ customer support at 1-866-227-2068 or http://www.ibm.com/contact/us/.

shortdesc.p: The IBM StoredIQ solution consists of these components: the application stack, the gateway, the data server, and optionally the Elasticsearch cluster.

topicmeta.shortdesc: The IBM StoredIQ solution consists of these components: the application stack, the gateway, the data server, and optionally the Elasticsearch cluster.

shortdesc.p: IBM StoredIQ provides three solution components: the gateway, data servers, and application stack (AppStack).

topicmeta.shortdesc: IBM StoredIQ provides three solution components: the gateway, data servers, and application stack (AppStack).

shortdesc.p: IBM StoredIQ provides interface applications that help fulfill its solution goals.

topicmeta.shortdesc: IBM StoredIQ provides interface applications that help fulfill its solution goals.

shortdesc.p: IBM StoredIQ Data Server user interface provides access to data server functionality. It allows administrators to view the dashboard and see the status of the jobs and system details. Administrators can manage information about servers and conduct various confirguations on the system and application settings.

topicmeta.shortdesc: IBM StoredIQ Data Server user interface provides access to data server functionality. It allows administrators to view the dashboard and see the status of the jobs and system details. Administrators can manage information about servers and conduct various confirguations on the system and application settings.

shortdesc.p: IBM StoredIQ Administrator helps you manage global assets common to the distributed infrastructure behind IBM StoredIQ applications.

topicmeta.shortdesc: IBM StoredIQ Administrator helps you manage global assets common to the distributed infrastructure behind IBM StoredIQ applications.

shortdesc.p: Using IBM StoredIQ Administrator, the Administrator can identify what data servers are deployed, their location, what data is being managed, and the status of each data server in the system.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Using IBM StoredIQ Administrator, the Administrator can identify what data servers are deployed, their location, what data is being managed, and the status of each data server in the system.

shortdesc.p: Harvesting, which can also be referred to as indexing, is the process or task by which IBM StoredIQ examines and clssifies data in your network.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Harvesting, which can also be referred to as indexing, is the process or task by which IBM StoredIQ examines and clssifies data in your network.

shortdesc.p: System infosets that use only specific indexed volumes can be created and managed within IBM StoredIQ Administrator.

topicmeta.shortdesc: System infosets that use only specific indexed volumes can be created and managed within IBM StoredIQ Administrator.

shortdesc.p: The user management area allows administrators to create users and manage users' access to the various IBM StoredIQ applications.

topicmeta.shortdesc: The user management area allows administrators to create users and manage users' access to the various IBM StoredIQ applications.

shortdesc.p: An action is any process that is taken upon the data that is represented by the indexes.

topicmeta.shortdesc: An action is any process that is taken upon the data that is represented by the indexes.

shortdesc.p: Provides an interface that allows the user to set the wanted targets for specific actions that require a destination volume for their actions.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Provides an interface that allows the user to set the wanted targets for specific actions that require a destination volume for their actions.

shortdesc.p: IBM StoredIQ Administrator provides a number of built-in reports, such as summaries of data objects in the system, storage use, and the number of identical documents in the system.

topicmeta.shortdesc: IBM StoredIQ Administrator provides a number of built-in reports, such as summaries of data objects in the system, storage use, and the number of identical documents in the system.

shortdesc.p: Provides the ability to relate business concepts to indexed data.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Provides the ability to relate business concepts to indexed data.

shortdesc.p: Helps you to create Mule scripts and upload script packages.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Helps you to create Mule scripts and upload script packages.

shortdesc.p: Big data is a pervasive problem, not a one-time occurrence. It is easy for most companies to realize that big data is problematic, but it is hard to identify what problems they have. Big data is all about the unknown, but the unknown cannot be off limits. IBM StoredIQ Data Workbench can help you learn about your data, make educated decisions with your most valuable asset, and turn your company's most dangerous risk into its most valuable asset.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Big data is a pervasive problem, not a one-time occurrence. It is easy for most companies to realize that big data is problematic, but it is hard to identify what problems they have. Big data is all about the unknown, but the unknown cannot be off limits. IBM StoredIQ Data Workbench can help you learn about your data, make educated decisions with your most valuable asset, and turn your company's most dangerous risk into its most valuable asset.

shortdesc.p: IBM StoredIQ Policy Manager allows users to run mature policies and processes at scale across a wider range of data.

topicmeta.shortdesc: IBM StoredIQ Policy Manager allows users to run mature policies and processes at scale across a wider range of data.

shortdesc.p: IBM StoredIQ Desktop Data Collector (also referred to as desktop client indexes desktops as volumes. The volumes appear in IBM StoredIQ Data Server and in IBM StoredIQ Administrator, where they can be used like any other data source.

topicmeta.shortdesc: IBM StoredIQ Desktop Data Collector (also referred to as desktop client indexes desktops as volumes. The volumes appear in IBM StoredIQ Data Server and in IBM StoredIQ Administrator, where they can be used like any other data source.

shortdesc.p: When you plan a deployment of IBM StoredIQ, evaluate several infrastructure considerations.

topicmeta.shortdesc: When you plan a deployment of IBM StoredIQ, evaluate several infrastructure considerations.

topic.title: Generate customized reports with the SPCR tool

topicmeta.navtitle: Generate customized reports with the SPCR tool
topicmeta.linktext: Generate customized reports with the SPCR tool

shortdesc.p: IBM StoredIQ is deployed as virtual appliances and is supported in VMware ESXi 5.0 (all fix pack levels) or VMware ESXi 6.0 (all fix pack levels) environments. You must have a virtual infrastructure that meets the IBM StoredIQ hardware requirements.

topicmeta.shortdesc: IBM StoredIQ is deployed as virtual appliances and is supported in VMware ESXi 5.0 (all fix pack levels) or VMware ESXi 6.0 (all fix pack levels) environments. You must have a virtual infrastructure that meets the IBM StoredIQ hardware requirements.

shortdesc.p: The general size limits for a data server are 150 million objects or 500 defined volumes, whichever limit is reached first. Assuming an average object size of 200 KB equals about 30 TB of managed storage across 30 volumes of 5 million objects each, the index storage requirement for metadata on ~30 TB of storage that contains uncompressed general office documents is ~330 GB (11 GB per TB). Add 100 GB per TB of managed storage for full-text or snippet index.

topicmeta.shortdesc: The general size limits for a data server are 150 million objects or 500 defined volumes, whichever limit is reached first. Assuming an average object size of 200 KB equals about 30 TB of managed storage across 30 volumes of 5 million objects each, the index storage requirement for metadata on ~30 TB of storage that contains uncompressed general office documents is ~330 GB (11 GB per TB). Add 100 GB per TB of managed storage for full-text or snippet index.

shortdesc.p: If you deploy this type of data server, you must also deploy an Elasticsearch cluster with at least one node. If you deploy a cluster with more nodes, each of the Elasticsearch nodes must meet the listed requirements.

topicmeta.shortdesc: If you deploy this type of data server, you must also deploy an Elasticsearch cluster with at least one node. If you deploy a cluster with more nodes, each of the Elasticsearch nodes must meet the listed requirements.

shortdesc.p: The required memory depends on the index size that is handled by the data node. For a better performance, consider increasing the memory. The total memory available to the node must be distributed between the host operating system, the Elasticsearch java heap space, and the kernel file system caches.

topicmeta.shortdesc: The required memory depends on the index size that is handled by the data node. For a better performance, consider increasing the memory. The total memory available to the node must be distributed between the host operating system, the Elasticsearch java heap space, and the kernel file system caches.

shortdesc.p: For proper communication, the IBM StoredIQ components must be able to connect to each other.

topicmeta.shortdesc: For proper communication, the IBM StoredIQ components must be able to connect to each other.

topic.title: TCP: port ranges for the firewall

topicmeta.navtitle: TCP: port ranges for the firewall
topicmeta.linktext: TCP: port ranges for the firewall

shortdesc.p: The following ports are open by default on the IBM StoredIQ.

topicmeta.shortdesc: The following ports are open by default on the IBM StoredIQ.

shortdesc.p: By default, port 22 is open on all IBM StoredIQ hosts. The port is used for Secure Shell (SSH) communication and allows remote administration access to the VM. In general, traffic is encrypted using password authentication.

topicmeta.shortdesc: By default, port 22 is open on all IBM StoredIQ hosts. The port is used for Secure Shell (SSH) communication and allows remote administration access to the VM. In general, traffic is encrypted using password authentication.

shortdesc.p: The ports and services on the IBM StoredIQ data server are enabled or disabled using a script with the appropriate parameters.

topicmeta.shortdesc: The ports and services on the IBM StoredIQ data server are enabled or disabled using a script with the appropriate parameters.

topic.title: IBM StoredIQ gateway supported chain and rules

topicmeta.navtitle: IBM StoredIQ gateway supported chain and rules
topicmeta.linktext: IBM StoredIQ gateway supported chain and rules

topic.title: Opening ports for desktop client access to the data server

shortdesc.p: If you have an IBM StoredIQ OVA deployed system, you must open the ports for the desktop client to access the data server. On an upgraded system, the correct ports are open.

topicmeta.navtitle: Opening ports for desktop client access to the data server
topicmeta.linktext: Opening ports for desktop client access to the data server
topicmeta.shortdesc: If you have an IBM StoredIQ OVA deployed system, you must open the ports for the desktop client to access the data server. On an upgraded system, the correct ports are open.

shortdesc.p: To size an environment precisely, you must understand the factors such as harvest frequency, complexity of the source, and use case scenarios that drive application use and action execution.

topicmeta.shortdesc: To size an environment precisely, you must understand the factors such as harvest frequency, complexity of the source, and use case scenarios that drive application use and action execution.

shortdesc.p: Before a deployment, verify that you meet these prerequisites.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Before a deployment, verify that you meet these prerequisites.

shortdesc.p: Using the IBM License Metric Tool, you can generate license consumption reports that count IBM StoredIQ license usage. IBM StoredIQ is licensed by Resource Value Unit (RVU). RVU calculation is based on terabytes IBM StoredIQ.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Using the IBM License Metric Tool, you can generate license consumption reports that count IBM StoredIQ license usage. IBM StoredIQ is licensed by Resource Value Unit (RVU). RVU calculation is based on terabytes IBM StoredIQ.

topic.title: Integration with IBM License Metric Tool

shortdesc.p: Versions of IBM License Metric Tool (ILMT) that support IBM Software License Metric Tag (SLMT) can generate license consumption reports.

topicmeta.navtitle: Integration with IBM License Metric Tool
topicmeta.linktext: Integration with IBM License Metric Tool
topicmeta.shortdesc: Versions of IBM License Metric Tool (ILMT) that support IBM Software License Metric Tag (SLMT) can generate license consumption reports.

shortdesc.p: IBM StoredIQ comes with a set of default user accounts. For security reasons, change the passwords for these default accounts after the installation is complete so that they are unique and different from the default values.

topicmeta.shortdesc: IBM StoredIQ comes with a set of default user accounts. For security reasons, change the passwords for these default accounts after the installation is complete so that they are unique and different from the default values.

shortdesc.p: IBM StoredIQ is a virtual appliance that you deploy and configure in a VMWare virtual host environment.

topicmeta.shortdesc: IBM StoredIQ is a virtual appliance that you deploy and configure in a VMWare virtual host environment.

shortdesc.p: Use VMware vSphere Client to deploy the virtual appliances to an ESX server.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Use VMware vSphere Client to deploy the virtual appliances to an ESX server.

topic.title: Deploying IBM StoredIQ on Microsoft Hyper-V

shortdesc.p: As an alternative to installing on an ESX server, the IBM StoredIQ gateway, data server, and application stack can be installed on Microsoft Hyper-V. This option is not supported for the Elasticsearch virtual appliance.

topicmeta.navtitle: Deploying IBM StoredIQ on Microsoft Hyper-V
topicmeta.linktext: Deploying IBM StoredIQ on Microsoft Hyper-V
topicmeta.shortdesc: As an alternative to installing on an ESX server, the IBM StoredIQ gateway, data server, and application stack can be installed on Microsoft Hyper-V. This option is not supported for the Elasticsearch virtual appliance.
